data.title: Egypt student gets 3-year jail term for atheism -- An Egyptian court has sentenced a student to three years in jail for announcing on Facebook that he is an atheist and for insulting Islam

Huge crowds and some 40 world leaders have gathered in Paris for a unity march

Bomb threat at Belgian paper that reprinted Charlie Hebdo cartoons

Cuba Rolls Out Wi-Fi as Censorship Begins to Crumble - Cuba, where Internet access is largely limited to government employees and pricey pay-by-hour public access, will start offering wireless service for 1st time. Anyone wanting a router needs permission from the Communications Ministry.
Indian state plans 15Mbps broadband for households at a cost of $3 a month.
